body_html:
I tested it and it made no difference unfortunately.

The data is written in a csv file and I read it using Pandas. before your tips, I was converting the type to float like this (db is the loaded data)

db = db.astype('float')

and now I changed to

db = db.astype('float64')

but still it shows same problem. It is quite weird that GRU is okay but LSTM shows this behavior.

body:
I tested it and it made no difference unfortunately.

The data is written in a `csv` file and I read it using Pandas. before your tips, I was converting the type to float like this (`db` is the loaded data)

`db = db.astype('float')`

and now I changed to

`db = db.astype('float64')`

![2018-04-16_0-09-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18719591/38782543-6f7d4002-410a-11e8-8098-55f23bfd4364.png)

but still it shows same problem. It is quite weird that GRU is okay but LSTM shows this behavior.
